pageContext.claim: “Since coming into office, I have reduced refugee resettlement by 85%, and as you know, maybe especially in Minnesota, I kept another promise.”
pageContext.analysis: President Trump has dramatically decreased the number of refugees admitted to the U.S. but not by as much as he claims. In 2016, 96,900 people were admitted that dropped 76 percent to 22,900 in 2018. Trump reduced the cap to 18,000 for Fiscal 2020, which would be a 81 percent decline from 2016 if the maximum number of refugees are accepted.
